div1.head: Military Orders for Adolph F. Springer, August 15, 1901
div1.p:
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 61 - 1901
Springer - Mazzuri

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 175. }

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, August 15, 1901.

1. The Subsistence Department will commute the rations
of Private Adolph F. Springer, Hospital Corps, U. S. Army,
now on duty with Contract Surgeon James Carroll, U. S.
Army, in this city, from and including August 11, 1901,
and while on such duty, at the rate of seventy-five (75)
cents per day, it having been and being impracticable to
provide for his subsistence in any other way.

2. The payment of commutation of rations at the rate of
seventy-five (75) cents per day, since the abolishments of
the Departments of the Province of Havana and Pinar del
Río, Havana and Pinar del Río, and Western Cuba, made
by the Subsistence Department to the following named en-
listed men under the authority of the orders set opposite
their respective names, are confirmed as having been neces-
sary for the public service, viz.:

Private Frank Dobbratz, troop A, 7th Cavalry, per Spe-
cial Orders No. 73, series of 1900, Department of
the Province of Havana and Pinar del Río.

The Subsistence Department will continue to commute
the rations of the above named enlisted men while on such
duties at the rate of seventy-five (75) cents per day, it be-
ing impracticable to provide for their subsistence in any
other way.

3. By direction of the Secretary of War, a board of offi-
cers, to consist of:
Colonel T. A. Baldwin, 7th Cavalry;
Lieutenant Colonel W. S. Edgerly, 7th Cavalry;
Major Ezra B. Fuller, 10th Cavalry;

Captain E. F. Horr, Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Volun-
teers;

Captain P. Mazzuri, Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Volun-
teers;
Captain M. C. Butler, 7th Cavalry, Recorder;

will convene at Columbia Barracks, on or about August 19,
1901, or as soon thereafter as practicable, under the pro-
visions of General Orders No. 41, series of 1897, Head-
quarters of the Army, for the examination of 1st Lieuten-
ant Clyde E. Hawkins, 7th Cavalry, to determine his fitness
for promotion.

4. Lieutenant R. L. Collins, 2d Cavalry, is hereby re-
lieved from the duty enjoined by paragraph 1, Special Or-
ders No. 163, current series, these Headquarters, and will
proceed to join his proper station.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

5. The unexecuted portion of the sentence of general
court-martial in the case of private Frank Howarth, troop I,
7th Cavalry, as published by paragraph 10, Special Orders
No. 81, current series, these Headquarters, is hereby re-
mitted.
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL WOOD:

H. L. SCOTT,
Captain 7th Cavalry,
Adjutant General.
